channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Yellow cover, 13th November
item.description:
This yellow cover is outside 44 finucane drive and has been there for sometime I'm not sure if the actual issue has been fixed underneath it, if it has can it be removed please despite it being big and yellow I have tripped over it a few times and it's very slippery when very wet outside. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finucane Drive, Ramsden, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned very large video screen, cracked, on Royal Place, 13th November
item.description:
An abandoned very large TV screen, 1.5m wide, propped up vertically on pavement in Royal Place at the back of 61 Royal Hill, adjacent to 1A Royal Place SE10 8QF. Screen is dangerous, it could easily be knocked over by a child , the screen is already cracked and may disintegrate on pavement. A large primary school with several hundred children is just round the corner. Been there since 6 November

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Royal Place, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven paving and parking issue, 13th November
item.description:
At the Beatrice Road end of the alleyway the pavement is uneven and has some holes which are a trip hazard. My 80 year aunt fell when walking through yesterday, sustaining cuts to hands and bruising on hands and knees. She needed assistance from the cleaning team, who luckily were in the office at Beatrice Road, to get up. Beatrice Road also has several disabled and elderly residents and trying to get along this part of the pavement is difficult. This includes my mother who is in a wheelchair. Adding to this problem is the parking of vehicles at this end of the road. As it has no restrictions it is used like a car park often blocking the end of the road making walking through from the alleyway difficult (especially if using wheelchair, walking aid or people with prams) and blocking access to Maria Close.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beatrice Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet
